text: Jasswelt is a Swiss e-commerce platform that specializes in the sale of items related to the card game Jass, a traditional and widely played game in Switzerland. The website provides a range of products including playing cards, accessories, and custom-printed merchandise. In addition to Jass-related products, the shop offers a selection of board games, family games, and educational games. Jasswelt.ch serves both individual consumers and organizations, including businesses and public institutions, particularly through its services for product personalization. https://www.newspapers.com/newspage/17375956/ http://www.altacarta.com/english/research/switzerland.html https://www.pagat.com/jass/mittlere.html https://www.jassa.at/ http://www.idiotikon.ch/Register/faksimile.php?band=3&spalte;=70 https://www.pagat.com/draw/ https://www.pagat.com/patience/https://www.whydomath.org/Reading_Room_Material/ian_stewart/shuffle/shuffle.html https://www.parlettgames.uk/histocs/euchre.html https://archives.yale.edu/repositories/11/resources/827 http://www.pagat.com/fishing/ https://www.pagat.com/class/#mechanism https://www.parlettgames.uk/histocs/noddy.html https://www.archive.org/stream/tudorschool-boyl00viveuoft#page/185/mode/1up https://web.archive.org/web/20061003210948/http://www.academiccolab.org/resources/documents/Changing%20The%20Game- final_2.pdf http://journal.seriousgamessociety.org/index.php/IJSG/article/view/98/pdf_30 https://doi.org/10.1152%2Fadvan.00074.2020 https://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S1875952120300951 https://doi.org/10.1080%2F17439884.2022.2156537 https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/1046878120953592 https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/14703297.2018.1433547 https://web.archive.org/web/20160307170229/http://itamarshatz.me/wp- content/uploads/2015/09/Using-Gamification-and-Gaming-in-Order-to-Promote- Risk-Taking-in-the-Language-Learning-Process.pdf http://theweek.com/article/index/241121/7-health-benefits-of-playing-video- games https://www.academia.edu/3301669 https://doi.org/10.1016%2Fj.compedu.2017.05.016 https://www.jasswelt.ch/ == Background == Jass is a card game with deep cultural roots in Switzerland and is recognized as a traditional pastime across various regions of the country. The game is often played both casually and competitively, and it exists in several regional variants, including Schieber, Coiffeur, and Differenzler. Given the game's popularity, there is a steady demand for associated products and accessories, which has led to the emergence of specialized retailers like Jasswelt.ch. http://eprints.gla.ac.uk/151995/1/151995.pdf http://imp.sagepub.com/content/13/1/99 http://irep.ntu.ac.uk/id/eprint/5899/1/188352_5972%20Brown%20Publisher.pdf https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6188572 http://www.ifets.info/journals/12_2/1.pdf http://rer.sagepub.com/content/82/1/61 https://web.archive.org/web/20190403172725/https://www.thenation.com/article/how- much-do-we-learn-first-cut-history/ https://www.bl.uk/learning/histcitizen/georgians/material/materialculture.html == Cultural Context == Jass has been played in Switzerland for centuries and is often considered an integral part of the country’s cultural heritage. It is commonly played in homes, cafés, and at community events, and has been the subject of television broadcasts and tournaments. The availability of related products through specialized retailers such as Jasswelt.ch contributes to the preservation and continued popularity of the game in modern times.
